alert.note: Alert for Glascock; Jefferson; Warren (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Warren, central Glascock and northern Jefferson Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Wrens, or 13 miles east of Gibson, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Wrens, Stapleton, Avera, Edge Hill, Edgehill, Matthews, Stellaville and Stapletons Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
